trans-unit.source: Use SSL to securely access MySQL Database on Azure – Azure cloud
trans-unit.target: Use SSL to securely access MySQL Database on Azure – Azure cloud

trans-unit.source: Using SSL encryption to access databases helps ensure that your access is secure.
trans-unit.target: Using SSL encryption to access databases helps ensure that your access is secure.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to download and configure SSL certificates.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to download and configure SSL certificates.

trans-unit.source: MySQL Database on Azure currently supports the use of public keys to perform encryption and verification on the server side.
trans-unit.target: MySQL Database on Azure currently supports the use of public keys to perform encryption and verification on the server side.

trans-unit.source: Use SSL to securely access MySQL Database on Azure
trans-unit.target: Use SSL to securely access MySQL Database on Azure

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Chinese Version
trans-unit.target: Chinese Version

trans-unit.source: English Version
trans-unit.target: English Version

trans-unit.source: Using SSL encryption to access databases helps ensure that your access is secure.
trans-unit.target: Using SSL encryption to access databases helps ensure that your access is secure.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to download and configure SSL certificates.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to download and configure SSL certificates.

trans-unit.source: MySQL Database on Azure currently supports the use of public keys to perform encryption and verification on the server side.
trans-unit.target: MySQL Database on Azure currently supports the use of public keys to perform encryption and verification on the server side.

trans-unit.source: When you create a MySQL Database on Azure instance, we strongly recommend that you put the database instance in the same region as other Azure services.
trans-unit.target: When you create a MySQL Database on Azure instance, we strongly recommend that you put the database instance in the same region as other Azure services.

trans-unit.source: This helps ensure their security even if you do not use SSL encryption.
trans-unit.target: This helps ensure their security even if you do not use SSL encryption.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Download the public key certificates for an SSL connection
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Download the public key certificates for an SSL connection

trans-unit.source: [Click to download](https://www.wosign.com/root/WS_CA1_NEW.crt) the SSL certificate locally.
trans-unit.target: [Click to download](https://www.wosign.com/root/WS_CA1_NEW.crt) the SSL certificate locally.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Use SSL to connect to a server on MySQL Database on Azure
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Use SSL to connect to a server on MySQL Database on Azure

trans-unit.source: Configure by using the MySQL client
trans-unit.target: Configure by using the MySQL client

trans-unit.source: Using MySQL.exe as an example, you need to use the --ssl-ca parameter to specify a public key certificate when you create the connection.
trans-unit.target: Using MySQL.exe as an example, you need to use the --ssl-ca parameter to specify a public key certificate when you create the connection.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SSL connections, refer to “Using SSL for secure connections.”
trans-unit.target: For more information on SSL connections, refer to “Using SSL for secure connections.”

trans-unit.source: Reference examples:
trans-unit.target: Reference examples:

trans-unit.source: mysql.exe --ssl-ca=WS\_CA1\_NEW.crt -h mysqlservices.chinacloudapp.cn -u ssltest%test -p
trans-unit.target: mysql.exe --ssl-ca=WS\_CA1\_NEW.crt -h mysqlservices.chinacloudapp.cn -u ssltest%test -p

trans-unit.source: mysql.exe database access
trans-unit.target: mysql.exe database access

trans-unit.source: Once you have successfully connected, use the status command.
trans-unit.target: Once you have successfully connected, use the status command.

trans-unit.source: If the SSL parameter value is “Cipher in use,” then you have successfully created the SSL connection.
trans-unit.target: If the SSL parameter value is “Cipher in use,” then you have successfully created the SSL connection.

trans-unit.source: If the SSL parameter is “Not in use,” then the connection is still a non-SSL connection.
trans-unit.target: If the SSL parameter is “Not in use,” then the connection is still a non-SSL connection.

trans-unit.source: Verification
trans-unit.target: Verification

trans-unit.source: **Indicates **that the current certificate supports MySQL.exe 5.5.44 and 5.6.25, as well as subsequent versions.
trans-unit.target: **Indicates **that the current certificate supports MySQL.exe 5.5.44 and 5.6.25, as well as subsequent versions.

trans-unit.source: Using MySQL Workbench as an example, use the parameters label to set up the connection string for accessing the database, as shown in the image below.
trans-unit.target: Using MySQL Workbench as an example, use the parameters label to set up the connection string for accessing the database, as shown in the image below.

trans-unit.source: Configuring the connection string
trans-unit.target: Configuring the connection string

trans-unit.source: Configure the SSL certificate by using SSL labels
trans-unit.target: Configure the SSL certificate by using SSL labels

trans-unit.source: Configuring SSL certificates
trans-unit.target: Configuring SSL certificates

trans-unit.source: **Make sure that you** select “If Available” under Use SSL; otherwise, this may cause configuration failures.
trans-unit.target: **Make sure that you** select “If Available” under Use SSL; otherwise, this may cause configuration failures.

trans-unit.source: “SSL not enabled” may be shown during the test connection process.
trans-unit.target: “SSL not enabled” may be shown during the test connection process.

trans-unit.source: This is a false alarm, as the communication process is encrypted once you have clicked “OK” and connected to the database.
trans-unit.target: This is a false alarm, as the communication process is encrypted once you have clicked “OK” and connected to the database.

trans-unit.source: errormessage
trans-unit.target: errormessage

trans-unit.source: Configure by using functions
trans-unit.target: Configure by using functions

trans-unit.source: Using Python as an example, the image below shows a piece of sample code for your reference.
trans-unit.target: Using Python as an example, the image below shows a piece of sample code for your reference.

trans-unit.source: python SSL access
trans-unit.target: python SSL access
